messages.subject: New Chapters of Homeschool History Articles
messages.msgSnippet: Hello! We have the latest two chapters of the Homeschoolers History of Homeschooling series available on the web in pdf format and wanted to let you know. Here
messages.messageBody:
Hello!

We have the latest two chapters of the Homeschoolers History of Homeschooling
series available on the web in pdf format and wanted to let you know.

Here are the links:

www.gentlespirit.com/GS7N02/HSH5.pdf
Homeschoolers' History of Homeschooling, Part V, (from GS Vol. 7, No. 2)
The Gentle Spirit Controversy
Summer of 1994-Winter of 1995
Home-Centered Living; House Church Movement; Matthew 18
Church Discipline

www.gentlespirit.com/GS7N04/HSH6.pdf
Homeschoolers' History of Homeschooling, Part VI, (from GS Vol. 7, No. 4)
1995-1997
Religious Freedom Restoration Act; Sons of RFRA: The Parental Rights and
Responsibilities Act and the Restoring Local Schools Act, The Madison
Project; Rosenberger v. University of Virginia

Links to first four articles are as follows:

Part 1: Early American Education through 1990
http://www.gentlespirit.com/gs6n09/hsh1.pdf

Part 2: Influences: Unschooling--Raymond and Dorothy Moore--Secular
Humanism Perceived as a Threat--Bill Gothard
http://www.gentlespirit.com/gs6n10/HSH2.pdf

Part 3: 1990-1992
http://www.gentlespirit.com/gs6n11/hsh3b.pdf

Part 4: H.R. 6
http://www.gentlespirit.com/gs7n01/hsh4.pdf

Regards,

Cheryl Lindsey Seelhoff
Editor, Gentle Spirit Magazine
